info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:05PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF ROOSEVELT AND SOUTHEASTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM MDT... At 303 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Portales, moving east at 55 mph. Other strong storms were located near Clovis and Saint Vrain. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Texico, Elida, Dora, Causey, Milnesand, Saint Vrain, Ranchvale and Arch. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 368 and 397. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for Curry county in east central New Mexico.
